title: Richbased
author: Richbased
content: I think we the newbie here should be conversant with some trading terms here like CFDs, binance, indices, DIP and HODL and so one. I plead with some of our senior members here to create  threads that will educate us on this trading terms and acronyms and also the right techniques to follow in trading so that it will guide us during trading times. I know everything in life is about stages but it is important that we have a pre-knowledge of how trading works and how to follow the right concept.

comments.author: Roseline492
comments.body: OP is actually nice having a desire to become either forex trader or a crypto trader, but however I don't think knowing those terms without the plans to really acquire the right knowledge that you really need on trading is good, but however if is about DIP and HODL, perhaps the meaning of HODL is Hold on for  Dear Life,  which in times of crypto strategy is that don't sell your coins until it gets to your targeted price in the future while DIP is buying crypto when the price has depreciated or rather falls.

comments.author: Richbased
comments.body: Quote from: Roseline492 on October 08, 2023, 12:27:11 PMOP is actually nice having a desire to become either forex trader or a crypto trader, but however I don't think knowing those terms without the plans to really acquire the right knowledge that you really need on trading is good, but however if is about DIP and HODL, perhaps the meaning of HODL is Hold on for  Dear Life,  which in times of crypto strategy is that don't sell your coins until it gets to your targeted price in the future while DIP is buying crypto when the price has depreciated or rather falls. Yes I know it will take time for a beginner to be accustomed to terms that are used in trading but it is also good to have a pre-knowledge of what this terms and acronyms stands for so that as one is gradually coming up in the system they won't sound strange to them anymore

comments.author: Benedictare
comments.body: In the cryptocurency industry, trading is the most important.A good trader has to know the way of trading, terminology and understand the characteristics of specialization and generating source of a detaimed examination and many other things ,such as tags, limit orders ,stop-loss,bids. e.t.c.Limit order÷ it has to do with a request to buyer sell an exact amount of an asset at a particular price.Buy limit ÷ involves in setting a price below the current market amount. Sell limit ÷involves in a way of selling at a particular higher price than the market price.Stop loss÷ it is used to reduce possibilities of losses when you  set a certain price of an asset you want to sell in case of price drop.Currency Pair ÷This involves the two currency which you are going to use for trading among themselves. Bid ÷ is the price which you want to buy cryptocurency. Ask÷ is the amount of an asset in which the seller is prepared to sell. Spread  is the differences between the two prices .Market order ÷ is a procedure to an exchange forum to buy and sell cryptocurency under a fixed conditions.  A market order will urgently be met at any price available, the only  thing you have to set is the amount of Bitcoin or other cryptocurrency you  want  to buy or sell which an exchange will carry out your order fully.

Trading is a different thing entirely and it’s not encouraged for newbies to go into it without having sufficient knowledge about it. Don’t be surprised or discouraged not to have seen a thread that gives a step to step guideline on how to trade, it is because it is very risky and many users have different approach on how they trade. The one that works for one won’t work for many and vice versa. If you really want to learn more about trading, you can check the Trading Discussion board in the forum, waiting for a thread in the local board for that might not come now if we don’t have anyone from here that is very good at trading. Quote from: Richbased on October 11, 2023, 06:56:05 AMThat's exactly what am saying that the beginners need to be conversant with some trading methods because most of the beginners here don't even have and idea of what bit coin is and most of them are being told what to do and what not to do by people that refer them to this forum, they have no idea of how things work here they just follow instructions of the person that registered them on this platform and they are instructed to just keep posting or make topics.This depends on the boundary you set for yourself after joining the forum. The person that most have introduced you here must have also told you on the rules guiding the forum and since you want to be careful not to break any rule, you’ll want to follow their guide. Following their guide is not bad but it will limit you to some certain things if you don’t add to your knowledge by exploring the forum more by yourself and get a better grasp of it. It is good to have a mentor but the rules, information and threads here is enough mentorship to guide you throughout your stay here and your journey in bitcoin.Quote from: Richbased on October 11, 2023, 06:56:05 AMFor me if someone is on this platform and finding some things strange to understand you will see that the person might start loosing interest because they might feel that maybe the person that registered them here are using them to favor themselves in one way or the other and some people here does that they open accounts for people and be using their accounts to their own selfish interest but if one becomes accustomed to how everything works here there won't be any doubt on how the account is being runnedThis also depends on your perspectives of the person and what he does to have been using your account to their selfish interest which I still can’t imagine how that is possible. Your ideas and knowledge you’ve learnt from the forum will always be yours and not even the person that brought you here can collect that from you. If you continue to be under the shadow of someone even when you can stand on your own, you’ll be limited to some things. Forum is a well explanative and interactive place that is easy to understand when you put your mind at it. So you won’t remain under a person forever if you’re ready to learn by yourself more to what you’re been introduced to in the first place.

comments.author: Cryptoprincess101
comments.body: Quote from: Richbased on October 08, 2023, 11:56:18 AMI think we the newbie here should be conversant with some trading terms here like CFDs, binance, indices, DIP and HODL and so one. I plead with some of our senior members here to create  threads that will educate us on this trading terms and acronyms and also the right techniques to follow in trading so that it will guide us during trading times. I know everything in life is about stages but it is important that we have a pre-knowledge of how trading works and how to follow the right concept. As a beginner, I believe the best way of learning is to first observe how things are going before we seek knowledge on trading activities. As a newbie or a beginner it is not advisable to just rush into trading without knowing some trading ethics that should be followed in other not be misinformed, learning is a gradual process as you can't rush into knowing basic trading terms and acronyms when you are not familiar with the trading environment, so it ought to be one step at a time then from time to time you will start being conversant with the trading methods.

comments.author: Gormicsta
comments.body: Quote from: Richbased on October 08, 2023, 11:56:18 AMI think we the newbie here should be conversant with some trading terms here like CFDs, binance, indices, DIP and HODL and so one. I plead with some of our senior members here to create  threads that will educate us on this trading terms and acronyms and also the right techniques to follow in trading so that it will guide us during trading times. I know everything in life is about stages but it is important that we have a pre-knowledge of how trading works and how to follow the right concept.Absolutely! FOMO (Fear of Missing Out) is a particularly significant notion in the cryptocurrency realm. Because of the high levels of unpredictability and the "get rich quick" mindset that some investors possess. There are several tales of people who purchased Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies at a cheap price, kept onto them, and then saw their value explode, earning them a lot of money. This might cause FOMO in folks who believe they missed out on this chance. However, keep in mind that cryptocurrency markets are notoriously unpredictable, and there is no assurance that this will happen again.

comments.author: Fiasem20
comments.body: Op I would say all what you've said it's part of our learning process as newbies.I'm also a newbie but with the little knowledge I've acquired in this forum I can say I'm conversant with some acronyms used in the crypto space.Acronyms like HODL,KYC,GOING TO THE MOON,BULLISH/BEARISH,BUY THE DIP(BTD)1.HODL:The acronym hodl is Hold on for dear life.This word encourages investors to hold their asset even when the price is low with the expectation that the price would increase in the future.2.KYC:The acronym KYC is know your customer or know your client.The KYC platform is used to identify a user's personal identity.It's quite risky because everyone ought to be anonymous in the crypto space.3.GOING TO THE MOON:This word is used in the crypto space it refers to investors that have the belief that the price of the asset they are hodling would increase in the future.4.BULLISH/BEARISH: Bullish is when the price of an asset increase while bearish is when the price of an asset decrease.5.BUY THE DIP(BTD): Buying the dip refers to when an investor buy an asset when the price is low with the belief that it will increase in the future.So these acronyms are what I'm conversant with as a newbie,I'm here to learn and grow in the crypto space.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Op Dip and hodle is not a Trading term but it is an investment term. On thing you should also know is to understand the different between trading and investing. Trading is the process of buying and selling instantly, or hours. And there are times use in the Trading platforms. And the first one you have to k ow is the stop lose and take profit. These two are so much important in trading that if you don't know them then you are not ready for trade yet. After knowing these ones then you learn how to use the candle sticks and the uses. Then bearish and bullish are also terms use in the trading side of the ecosystem. If you need explanation of those terms then in .my next comment I will do that but for the time being you can browse them out and red more on them
